Key Match Events: The Chicago White Sox swept the Los Angeles Angels with a 7-0 win on September 26, 2024, avoiding breaking the MLB loss record.
The White Sox's red-hot hitting lifted the crowd to a standing ovation.
Pre-Game Insights: Fans were hoping to watch the White Sox lose to claim baseball’s modern record for the worst season ever.
Post-Match Reflections: Sox fan Alan Kahn expressed disappointment as he had hoped for a loss to break the record.
Sox fan Dan Lewis expressed frustration with the team's inability to lose and break the record.
Dave Cella, a cameraman for White Sox broadcasts, reflected on the team's disappointing season despite having talented players.
Sox fan Brian Biel expressed his disappointment by modifying his jersey and giving up on buying season tickets for the first time in 26 years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox offered promotions such as $5 beers and clearance sales on unsold gear to attract fans.
Crowds were more hostile earlier in the series, with fans wearing paper bags over their heads and chanting 'Sell The Team'.
